item.title: C# Object Initializer: More thoughts
item.description: I wrote previously about my dislike of C#’s object initializer syntax and while I still think those arguments hold I came across an interesting argument for why it is a useful feature in Jeremy Miller’s MSDN article on creating internal DSLs in C#. In the article Jeremy works through an example where he builds up a ‘SendMessageRequest’ first by using a fluent interface and then by making use of object initializer syntax.
